Subject: BrainFarm - Java version of NEAT

--00c09f8997023e4017048ea0777d
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Daniel Touhy and I have spent some time creating a new Java verson of NEAT.
This was being developed until earlier this year. Since then both of us have
been busy with other things and haven't had the time to work on the project
so i thought i'd just post a message to the list to let people know it's
there if anyone wanted to check out the 'story so far'.

We began with Ugo Vierucci's JNEAT code and basically refactored the hell
out of it. There's a lot of work gone into it so far and it's definately
taking shape but there's still plenty to do so if anyone's interested in
using it or contributing then feel free to get in touch with me and i'll be
glad to help where i can.

 The core engine is easily extensible and there's a format for creating
experiments as .jar files. The core then loads the jar and runs the
experiment. Or you can just code the whole thing.

There are the beginnings of 2 UIs for the app; one in Java/Swing and the
other in Flash/Flex (for use as a web-based client).

Brainfarm will probably become actively developed again in the coming months
but in the meantime like i say, i just thought i'd let the list know it's
there just in case it's useful for anyone.

It's currently hosted on googlecode:

http://code.google.com/p/brainfarm/


Thanks for listening :)

-- 
Trevor Burton
http://www.quick.tv

--00c09f8997023e4017048ea0777d
